etymology.description: 房(房) (fáng, "house; room") + 子(子) (zi, "son; child; noun suffix") forms the word 房子(房子) (fángzi, "house"), which represents a structure for living.
etymology.interpretation: The term 房子(房子) (fángzi, "house") combines the character 房(房) (fáng, "house; room") with the suffix 子(子) (zi, "noun suffix"), indicating a place where people live. The suffix does not change the meaning but rather serves to nominalize and complete the concept of a domestic building.

examples.chinese: 旧金山的房子非常贵(舊金山的房子非常貴)。
examples.english: Houses in San Francisco are very expensive.

examples.chinese: 我梦想拥有一座大房子(我夢想擁有一座大房子)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mèngxiǎng yǒngyǒu yī zuò dà fángzi.
examples.english: I dream of owning a big house.

examples.chinese: 小镇上的房子古色古香(小鎮上的房子古色古香)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo zhèn shàng de fángzi gǔsègǔxiāng.
examples.english: The houses in the small town exude an antique charm.
